segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 12. Kesivagga
segments.en: 12. With Kesi

segments.pli: 114. Nāgasutta
segments.en: 114. A Royal Elephant

segments.pli: “Catūhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato rañño nāgo rājāraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅganteva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a royal bull elephant with four factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.

segments.pli: Katamehi catūhi?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo sotā ca hoti, hantā ca, khantā ca, gantā ca.
segments.en: A royal bull elephant listens, destroys, endures, and goes fast.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo sotā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a royal bull elephant listen?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo yamenaṃ hatthidammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāreti—
segments.en: It’s when a royal bull elephant pays heed, pays attention, engages wholeheartedly, and lends an ear to whatever task the elephant trainer has it do,

segments.pli: yadi vā katapubbaṃ yadi vā akatapubbaṃ—
segments.en: whether or not it has done it before.

segments.pli: taṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbacetasā samannāharitvā ohitasoto suṇāti.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo sotā hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant listens.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo hantā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a royal bull elephant destroy?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo saṅgāmagato hatthimpi hanati, hatthāruhampi hanati, assampi hanati, assāruhampi hanati, rathampi hanati, rathikampi hanati, pattikampi hanati.
segments.en: It’s when a royal bull elephant in battle destroys elephants with their riders, horses with their riders, chariots and charioteers, and foot soldiers.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo hantā hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant destroys.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khantā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a royal bull elephant endure?

segments.pli: Idha bhikkhave, rañño nāgo saṅgāmagato khamo hoti sattippahārānaṃ asippahārānaṃ usuppahārānaṃ bheripaṇavasaṅkhatiṇavaninnādasaddānaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a royal bull elephant in battle endures being struck by spears, swords, arrows, and axes; it endures the thunder of the drums, kettledrums, horns, and cymbals.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khantā hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant endures.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo gantā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a royal bull elephant go fast?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo yamenaṃ hatthidammasārathi disaṃ peseti—
segments.en: It’s when a royal bull elephant swiftly goes in whatever direction the elephant trainer sends it,

segments.pli: yadi vā gatapubbaṃ yadi vā agatapubbaṃ—
segments.en: whether or not it has been there before.

segments.pli: taṃ khippameva gantā hoti.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo gantā hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant goes fast.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi aṅgehi samannāgato rañño nāgo rājāraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅganteva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.
segments.en: A royal bull elephant with four factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu āhuneyyo hoti … pe … anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.
segments.en: In the same way, a mendicant with four factors is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.

segments.pli: Katamehi catūhi?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sotā ca hoti, hantā ca, khantā ca, gantā ca.
segments.en: A mendicant listens, destroys, endures, and goes fast.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sotā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant listen?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye desiyamāne aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbacetasā samannāharitvā ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇāti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant pays heed, pays attention, engages wholeheartedly, and lends an ear when the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One is being taught.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sotā hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant listens.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hantā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant destroy?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ nādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti hanati byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti, uppannaṃ byāpādavitakkaṃ … pe … uppannaṃ vihiṃsāvitakkaṃ … pe … uppannuppanne pāpake akusale dhamme nādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti hanati byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t tolerate a sensual, malicious, or cruel thought. They don’t tolerate any bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen, but give them up, get rid of them, eliminate them, and obliterate them.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hantā hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant destroys.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khantā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant endure?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya, ḍaṃsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphassānaṃ duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ adhivāsakajātiko hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant endures cold, heat, hunger, and thirst; the touch of flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and reptiles; rude and unwelcome criticism; and they put up with physical pain—sharp, severe, acute, unpleasant, disagreeable, and life-threatening.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khantā hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant endures.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gantā hoti?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant go fast?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yāyaṃ disā agatapubbā iminā dīghena addhunā yadidaṃ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṃ, taṃ khippaññeva gantā hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant swiftly goes in the direction they’ve never gone before in all this long time; that is, the stilling of all activities, the letting go of all attachments, the ending of craving, fading away, cessation, extinguishment.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gantā hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant goes fast.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu āhuneyyo hoti … pe … anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassā”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant with these four factors … is the supreme field of merit for the world.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, a royal bull elephant with four factors is…

suttaplex.blurb: A mendicant is like a king’s elephant.
